author: Special Correspondent
text:
A large number of devotees offered worship to Namperumal and Sri Kamalavalli Nachiyar on the occasion of the ‘Seththi’ festival at Sri Kamalavalli Nachiyar Temple in Woraiyur on Saturday. Namperumal was brought from Sri Ranganathaswamy temple in Srirangam at about 3 a.m. and reached Woraiyur at around 6 a.m. After a procession in the main streets in Woraiyur, Namperumal was brought to the Seththi mandapam at the temple at about 11 a.m., marking the commencement of the festival.

Special ‘alankaram’ was performed to the deities. This annual festival forms part of the ‘Panguni Uthiram’ and falls on the sixth day of the festival currently on at Srirangam Sri Ranganathaswamy temple. Adequate arrangements were made for regulating the queue.
title: Seththi festival at Nachiyar temple
